project.teaser: Due to the current energy crisis, the EU is reaching a critical point in the energy transition with the Clean Energy Package. Residential demand response (DR) is a promising framework whose potential is completely untapped nowadays. DR-RISE's main objective is to demonstrate...
project.objective: Due to the current energy crisis, the EU is reaching a critical point in the energy transition with the Clean Energy Package. Residential demand response (DR) is a promising framework whose potential is completely untapped nowadays. DR-RISE's main objective is to demonstrate the benefits of DR in the residential sector, not only for the end-consumers but for the overall energy system and the actors involved. We will offer a holistic set of tools and services with a twofold objective: increase energy efficiency via optimal management and demonstrate the benefits (not only economic) of DR. The platform will be demonstrated in three different EU countries, focusing on gathering the most diverse environments (e.g., pre-existing energy communities, smart villages, urban blocks of flats, low-income households, etc.). Our approach is completely aligned with the EU's vision to place the citizens at the heart of the solution and empower them so that they can make self-aware decisions. Furthermore, we have developed a methodology around a strong social component that includes a significant co-design process of the tools with the end-consumers, considering vulnerable groups to provide a completely inclusive solution. A first iteration in the pilots will be deployed to assess the DR benefits, including the minimum required devices to do so. Then, building on the previous results, we will iterate a second time by including new hardware and DR approaches to compare the outcomes with the previous baseline. This two-phased methodology will allow us to take corrective measures if needed and assess the potential benefits of multiple sensors and control devices. The platform will therefore reach TRL7/8 by project completion. Furthermore, our plan for dissemination and exploitation, including communication activities, contemplates building the energy helix to reach more than 150 relevant organisations and potentiate clustering activities with initiatives such as BRIDGE and Built4People

project.keywords: Demand response, prosumer, energy market, energy transition, active consumer

result.title: Privacy and security technical measures [M18]
result.description: Implementation of measures to ensure privacy and security. It will include anonymisation methods and compliance with GDPR (IDE) [M18, M42]. This deliverable is linked to T4.6.

result.title: Guidelines to foster the end-consumer’s active participation [M10]
result.description: A set of guidelines will be generated as an output with tailored actions depending on the consumer segments (input for T2.1) to enable and sustain their participation (TUDO) [M10]. This deliverable is linked to T1.2.

result.title: DR-RISE dissemination and communication plan [M06]
result.description: A document containing the Dissemination and Communication Plan (DCP) describing the projects strategy, activities and implementation instruments (STAM) [M06, M24, M48]. This deliverable is linked to T6.2, T6.6 and T6.7.

result.title: Optimisation strategies for DR report [M18]
result.description: Document containing the different optimisation strategies applied for the two different Smart Nodes of the system (IDE) [M18, M42]. This deliverable is linked to T4.2.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DR-RISE (Demand Response - Residential Innovation for a Sustainable Energy system)

result.title: Barriers and enablers across three lenses [M06]
result.description: Report containing barriers and enablers of citizen/consumer engagment in residentail demand reponse across three lenses: technological, socioeconomic and institutional (SET) [M06]. This deliverable is linked to T1.3.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
